article.headline: Holy Cross 67, Harvard 59
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Jave Meade scored 13 points and added eight assists and eight rebounds on Tuesday night as Holy Cross pulled away late for a 67-59 win over Harvard. Meade assisted on Kevin Hamilton's 3-pointer with 1:55 to play that broke a 58-58 tie and put the Crusaders (2-0) ahead for good. Harvard, trailing 50-42, went to a zone defense and held Holy Cross without a field goal for 9:28 eventually taking a 54-52 lead with 4:58 remaining after Harvard's Matt Stehle scored two consecutive field goals. Kevin Rogus had 16 points to lead Harvard (0-2). Holy Cross, playing without starting center Nate Lufkin, employed a variety of presses to take a 17-10 lead with 11:58 to play in the first half. Hamilton (12 points) then scored six consecutive points and Greg Kinsey hit a 3-point field goal as the Crusaders took a 30-16 lead, their largest of the game. Stehle scored consecutive baskets underneath to spark a 9-0 run as Harvard narrowed the margin to 35-30 at halftime.
